question.text: Choose the correct statement about the patterns of biodiversity.

options.text: The diversity of plants and animals is uniform and evenly distributed throughout the world.
The tropics harbour more species than the temperate or polar regions.
Speciation is a function of time as the tropical latitudes have been disturbed by frequent glaciations in the past.
Lesser solar energy in the temperate regions contributes to higher productivity and greater diversity in species.

solution.text: In general, species diversity decreases as we move away from the equator towards the poles. With very few exceptions, tropics (latitudinal range of 23.5° N to 23.5° S) harbour more species than temperate or polar areas. Colombia located near the equator has nearly 1,400 species of birds, whereas New York at 41° N has 105 species and Greenland at 71° N has only 56 species.
